thread.title: David Accam salvages draw for Chicago Fire at Columbus Crew SC
thread.title_full: David Accam salvages draw for Chicago Fire at Columbus Crew SC

author: ESPN staff
title: David Accam salvages draw for Chicago Fire at Columbus Crew SC
text:
less than a minute ago David Accam salvages draw for Chicago Fire at Columbus Crew SC Sebastian Salazar and Herculez Gomez look at a revamped Chicago Fire, and if the playoffs are realistic for 2017. 
David Accam scored late in the second half to help the Chicago Fire salvage a 1-1 draw with Columbus Crew SC to open their Major League Soccer season on Saturday. 
Columbus, trying to rebound from missing the playoffs a year after reaching the championship game, took the lead in the 17th minute when Ethan Finlay headed in a long cross from Justin Meram. 
But the Fire hit back in the 73rd minute when Dax McCarty intercepted a pass at midfield and quickly put the ball forward to John Gossens, who slotted it ahead to Accam. 
Accam dribbled into the box, where he turned around a Crew defender before rolling a shot into the far right corner. 
Follow @ESPNFC on Twitter to keep up with the latest football updates.
